issue.title: [Python] Remove legacy property definition syntax from parquet module and test them
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2760](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2760). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2760?focusedCommentId=16541517) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Can you elaborate on what you call "legacy property definition syntax"?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2760?focusedCommentId=16541519) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
See the second block https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/userguide/extension_types.html#properties 
```Java

cdef class Spam:

    property cheese:

        "A doc string can go here."

        def __get__(self):
# This is called when the property is read.
            ...

        def __set__(self, value):
# This is called when the property is written.
            ...

        def __del__(self):
# This is called when the property is deleted.
```
syntax is deprecated.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2760?focusedCommentId=16550232) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Moved this off 0.10. If it gets merged in time, that's great, but doesn't fix bugs / add features

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2760?focusedCommentId=16559891) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 2187
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2187>
